flavor: "Please stay connected. Priority transfer in progress. An operator will shortly verif-"
text: Draw 3 cards.
name: Anonymous Tip

flavor: When You Need the Human Touch.
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
name: Jinteki: Personal Evolution

flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.
text:
X is equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
Place X advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
name: Psychographics

flavor: "Do you think they... feel it?"
text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
name: Archived Memories

flavor: There was a new texture in her phantom cortex. It had always been there, she realized. It was everything and nothing.
text: Look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
name: Precognition

flavor: The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone... for a small fee.
text: Gain 3 [Credits].
name: Beanstalk Royalties

text:
Ghost Branch can be advanced.
When the Runner accesses Ghost Branch, you may give the Runner 1 tag for each advancement token on Ghost Branch.
name: Ghost Branch

text:
Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.
If you pay 2 [Credits] when the Runner accesses Aggressive Secretary, trash 1 program for each advancement token on Aggressive Secretary.
name: Aggressive Secretary

text:
If the Runner is about to expose a card, you may rez Zaibatsu Loyalty.
1 [Credits] or [Trash]: Prevent 1 card from being exposed.
name: Zaibatsu Loyalty

flavor: Effective. Reliable. Humane.
text: The first time you install a card each turn, gain 1 [Credits].
name: Haas-Bioroid: Engineering the Future

text:
If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.

If you pay 4 [Credits] when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.
name: Snare!

flavor: Someone is Always Watching.
text:
2 [Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during trace attempts.
name: NBN: Making News

flavor: Moving Upwards.
text: Gain 1 [Credits] whenever you play a transaction operation.
name: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World

flavor: "I solve problems."
text: X [Credits], [Trash]: Choose a piece of rezzed ice protecting this server. That ice has +X strength until the end of the turn.
name: Corporate Troubleshooter

text:
Project Junebug can be advanced.
If you pay 1 [Credits] when the Runner accesses Project Junebug, do 2 net damage for each advancement token on Project Junebug.
name: Project Junebug

flavor: Access HarmlessFile.datZ -> Are you sure? y/n
text: [Subroutine] Do 1 net damage. Trash Data Mine.
name: Data Mine

flavor: "Feed the Feds our scraps, and they'll come back begging for more." - Richard Polasco, VP of Cyber-Security
text: [Click], trash a rezzed piece of ice: Gain 4 [Credits].
name: Security Subcontract

flavor:
"And then there's these two crates. No eID."
"Just leave those with me and forget you ever saw them."
text: Place 1 advancement token on each of up to 2 different installed cards that can be advanced.
name: Shipment from Kaguya

flavor: No contract. Just a handshake and a fistful of C-6 high explosives.
text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Trash up to 2 resources.
name: Freelancer

text: The Runner cannot run on remote servers. Ignore this ability until the end of the turn whenever the Runner runs on a central server.
name: Jinteki: Replicating Perfection

flavor: A Different Breed of Machine.
text: All bioroid ice has +1 strength.
name: Haas-Bioroid: Stronger Together

flavor: The key to the future lies in the past.
text: The trash cost of all installed cards is increased by 1.
name: Encryption Protocol

flavor: Looking out for your interests since 1984.
text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Give the Runner 2 tags.
name: Big Brother

flavor: The Division of Fringe Applications' revenue increased 37% year-over-year after corporate discovered that most of their projects made really fun toys.
text: Choose a piece of ice. Gain 1 [Credits] for each advancement token on that ice.
name: Commercialization

text: If Edge of World is installed and you pay 3 [Credits] when the Runner accesses it, do 1 brain damage for each piece of ice protecting this server.
name: Edge of World

text:
When your turn begins, take 1 [Credits] from Marked Accounts, if able.
[Click]: Place 3 [Credits] from the bank on Marked Accounts.
name: Marked Accounts

flavor: "Try to close it. Go on. See what it does." - Chaos Theory
text:
When the Runner encounters Pop-up Window, you gain 1 [Credits].
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 1 [Credits].
name: Pop-up Window

flavor: "You haven't run until you've seen the cybersun drift down behind the Great City, the space around you rippling with colors you can't imagine." - Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
text: Choose a server. Arrange the ice protecting that server in any order.
name: Sunset

flavor: Constructing Cyberspace.
text:
1 [Recurring Credits]
Use this credit to advance ice.
name: Weyland Consortium: Because We Built It

flavor: Keeping tabs on the world, one screen at a time.
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, trace5 - if successful, give the Runner 1 tag. If unsuccessful, trash Bernice Mai.
name: Bernice Mai

flavor: "It's kind of like an anagram." - designer Phoenix
text: Trace7 - If successful, trash 1 virtual resource or 1 link.
name: Foxfire

flavor: Also known as "development hell."
text: Shuffle 1 card from HQ into R&D.
name: Rework

flavor: "This ice sucks." - g00ru
text: [Subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run. Trash Whirlpool.
name: Whirlpool

flavor: I will serve you... for a time.
text:
Ronin can be advanced.
If there are at least 4 advancement tokens on Ronin, it gains "[Click], [Trash]: Do 3 net damage."
name: Ronin

flavor: "Looks like someone is being naughty..."
text: Once per run, when the Runner approaches a piece of ice protecting this server, you may swap that ice with a piece of ice from HQ. The new ice is installed unrezzed.
name: Midori

flavor: *Some restrictions may apply. Scan this card to find out more.
text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
name: NBN: The World Is Yours*

flavor: "If I had to describe the bugs in one word, it would be '****ing annoying.'" -Whizzard
text: [Subroutine]Trace0 - If successful, the Runner trashes 1 program.
name: Burke Bugs

flavor: The Once and Future Android.
text: You cannot include Jinteki cards in this deck.
name: Custom Biotics: Engineered for Success

text:
Cerebral Overwriter can be advanced.
If you pay 3 [Credits] when the Runner accesses Cerebral Overwriter, do 1 brain damage for each advancement token on Cerebral Overwriter.
name: Cerebral Overwriter

flavor: The densest information cluster in the galaxy.
text: Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.
name: Cerebral Imaging: Infinite Frontiers

text: Before taking your first turn, you may install up to 3 pieces of ice, with no more than a single piece of ice per server. Draw until you have 5 cards in HQ.
name: Next Design: Guarding the Net

flavor: "It is my job to ensure our creations are the perfect companions and edutainment for tomorrow's consumers."
text:
[Click]: Draw 2 cards.
Remove Jackson Howard from the game: Shuffle up to 3 cards from Archives into R&D.
name: Jackson Howard

flavor: Your free trial has expired. Upgrade to the full version?
text: Purge virus counters.
name: Cyberdex Trial

flavor: He signed for it, hand shaking in anticipation.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Place up to 2 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
name: Shipment from SanSan

flavor: Even with a virtual ball, it is considered rude not to yell "Fore!"
text: [Click]: Add 1 of your installed cards to HQ.
name: Isabel McGuire

flavor: Say it really fast.
text: Ireress gains "[Subroutine] The Runner loses 1 [Credits]." for each bad publicity you have.
name: Ireress

flavor: It folds under pressure.
text:
If all subroutines on Paper Wall are broken during a single encounter, trash Paper Wall.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Paper Wall

flavor: "They're the only labor cheaper than clones."
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Install a card from Archives or HQ, ignoring the install cost.
name: Interns

text:
If Shock! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Shock!, do 1 net damage, even if it is not installed.
name: Shock!

text:
Toshiyuki Sakai can be advanced.
If Toshiyuki Sakai is accessed while installed, you may swap him with an agenda or asset from HQ. The new agenda or asset is installed unrezzed, and keeps all advancement tokens on Toshiyuki Sakai. The Runner can choose not to access the new card.
name: Toshiyuki Sakai

flavor: He slowly pried open the lid, and the tantō glinted madly in the half-light. The executive motioned to the blade. Looks like the meeting was being cut short.
text: Trash one of your installed sysops, executives, or clones. If you do, remove up to 2 bad publicity.
name: Restoring Face

flavor: Geostrategic Research and Neothermal Development Laboratories
text: You start the game with 10 [Credits] and 1 bad publicity.
name: GRNDL: Power Unleashed

flavor: GRNDL refineries process many different rare elements unearthed during the fracking process.
text:
GRNDL Refinery can be advanced.
[Click], [Trash]: Gain 4 [Credits] for each advancement token on GRNDL Refinery.
name: GRNDL Refinery

text:
Gain 1 [Credits]. Gain [Click] if you have not played another Subliminal Messaging this turn.
If the Runner did not make a run during his or her last turn, you may add Subliminal Messaging to HQ from Archives when your turn begins.
name: Subliminal Messaging

flavor: The only thing worse than being fired and replaced by a younger, cheaper worker? Being replaced by an android.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Shuffle all cards in HQ into R&D. Draw 5 cards.
name: Corporate Shuffle

flavor: "It doesn't do anything in and of itself. It just marks you as an intruder and makes the next ice do all the work." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
text: [Subroutine] The next piece of ice the Runner encounters gains "[Subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines for the remainder of this run.
name: Marker

flavor: "You ever get that feeling like you're shark food? Pay attention to that feeling." - Ji "Noise" Reilly
text: The next piece of ice the Runner encounters during this run has +2 strength. Do 3 net damage unless the Runner breaks all subroutines on that piece of ice.
name: Chum

flavor: Analyzing was great. Delegating commands turned out to be even better.
text:
When the Runner encounters Matrix Analyzer, you may pay 1 [Credits] to place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.
[Subroutine] Trace 2 - if successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Matrix Analyzer

flavor: "The mining bosses are worse than any downstalk crime lords. Tri-Maf, 4K, Yak, I don't care what gangs you got down there. In Heinlein there's just one law: the He3 must flow." - "Old" Rick Henry, escaped clone.
text: [Click], [Click], [Click]: Gain 7 [Credits].
name: Melange Mining Corp

text:
Ice Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Ice Wall

flavor: Just don't ask how he does it.
text: The rez cost of ice protecting this server is lowered by 2.
name: Akitaro Watanabe

flavor: The new heads were in. Their eyes always followed your movements when you unlocked the pressurized container and lifted the lid.
text: Immediately install up to 3 cards (spending no clicks but paying all install costs).
name: Shipment from Mirrormorph

text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner loses all credits in his or her credit pool.
name: Closed Accounts

flavor: "I believe you'll find the terms are quite favorable."
text:
Play only if you scored an agenda this turn.
Search R&D for 1 card and add it to HQ.
Shuffle R&D.
name: Aggressive Negotiation

text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must pay 5 [Credits] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Red Herrings.
name: Red Herrings

flavor:
.//run/hunter-tr/return=true
client/sec256IPv7->confirm? /y
3926:0HB7:1001:2NB1:1601:7784:ERROR
text: [Subroutine] Trace3 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Hunter

flavor: Victos dracones numquam deride.
text:
When you rez Draco, you may pay X [Credits] to place X power counters on it.
Draco has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
[Subroutine] Trace2 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and end the run.
name: Draco

flavor: Sometimes uniqueness is overrated.
text: [Subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0 [Credits], 1 [Credits], or 2 [Credits]. Reveal spent credits. End the run if you and the Runner spent a different number of credits.
name: Snowflake

flavor: Smoke and mirrors optional.
text: Move up to 2 advancement tokens from a card to another installed card that can be advanced.
name: Trick of Light

text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
Trace2 - If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware with an install cost equal to or less than the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength.
name: Power Grid Overload

flavor: Green-two clearance is the highest level of security a corp can gain access to. Legally, anyway.
text: Gain 3 [Credits] and draw 1 card.
name: Green Level Clearance

flavor: This is the net. We work here. We're cops.
text:
X [Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during traces. X is the number of links the runner has.
name: Net Police

text: Rez a piece of ice, ignoring all costs, and install Oversight AI on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash host ice if all its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."
name: Oversight AI

flavor: Sniff.
text: [Subroutine] Trace2 - If successful, look at a number of cards from the top of the Runner's stack equal to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength. Trash 1 of those cards, and arrange the rest in any order.
name: Data Hound

flavor: Sometimes you just have to guess.
text: [Subroutine] You may install a piece of ice from HQ as teh outermost piece of ice protecting this server, ignoring all install costs.
name: Minelayer

flavor: Thomas, the director's son, has been carefully groomed to inherit the corporation since before he was born. His favorite passtime appears to be disappointing his mother.
text:
Thomas Haas can be advanced.
[Trash]: Gain 2 [Credits] for each advancement token on Thomas Haas.
name: Thomas Haas

text:
If the Runner is about to break a subroutine on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server you may rez Tyr's Hand.
[Trash]: Prevent a subroutine from being broken on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server.
name: Tyr's Hand

flavor: The Alix model was based on a successful hedge fund manager but she had a tendency to burn out. Literally.
text:
Place 1 power counter on Alix T4LB07 whenever you install a card.
[Click], [Trash]: Gain 2 [Credits] for each power counter on Alix T4LB07.
name: Alix T4LB07

flavor: "Yeah. It made a loud noise, I got scared, and I jacked out. I still think I made the right decision." - g00ru
text: [Subroutine] You may install and rez a piece of bioroid ice from HQ or Archives, ignoring all costs, placing it directly behind Howler. If you do, derez that piece of ice and trash Howler after the run is completed.
name: Howler

text:
Play only if the Runner installed a resource during his or her last turn.
Trace2 - If successful, add 1 installed resource to the top of the Runner's stack. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.
name: Hellion Alpha Test

flavor: "I'm getting a reading that is...off the charts. No, it crashed the charts. That counts as off, right?"
text: Look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are operations, you may play them (paying their play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Trash the rest of the unplayed cards you looked at.
name: Accelerated Diagnostics

text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Trash X cards from the top of R&D. The Runner trashes 1 installed program or piece of hardware with an install cost of X or less.
name: Power Shutdown

text:
Place 3 power counters on Rex Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Rex Campaign, trash it and either remove 1 bad publicity or gain 5 [Credits].
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Rex Campaign.
name: Rex Campaign

flavor: The button didn't seem to do anything. So he pushed it again. And again. And again.
text:
Install only in the root of HQ.
1 [Credits]: Draw 1 card. Use this ability only during a run on HQ
name: Panic Button

flavor:
"Let me get this straight. Your target market is 15-19 year old g-modded immigrants with one parent, a discretionary income over 2k a month, B+ or higher grades, an outgoing personality, and have a friend who owns a g-monkey?"
"Yes. Is that a problem?"
"No, not at all. I just don't get why your list is so short."
text: Gain 1 [Credits] for each card in the Runner's grip.
name: Sweeps Week

flavor:
The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow.
-Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
text:
[Subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
name: Yagura

text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Name a card other than Reclamation Order. Reveal any number of copies of the named card from Archives and add them to HQ.
name: Reclamation Order

flavor: It wants to have two subroutines when it grows up.
text: [Subroutine] End the run.
name: Quandary

text:
When you score Breaking News, give the Runner 2 tags.

When the turn on which you scored Breaking News ends, the Runner loses 2 tags.
name: Breaking News

flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.
text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.
name: Neural EMP

flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.
text: When you score Hostile takeover, gain 7 [Credits] and take 1 bad publicity.
name: Hostile Takeover

flavor: Floyd felt the anger in the man before him, ranting against simulants. His programming pushed a routine rebuttal to the front of his thoughts, and the urge to speak it was overwhelming. This is only gong to make things worse, he thought.
text: All ice protecting this server has +1 strength.
name: Experiential Data

flavor: "The SEA tipped us off to some suspicious data spikes up by the Castle." - Jerome Lock, on-duty tech
text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
Trace3 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: SEA Source

flavor: "Jack Weyland built the Beanstalk and transformed the human race forever. I can't wait to see what we're going to do next."
text:
Install only in the root of HQ.
Your maximum hand size is +2.
name: Research Station

flavor: It is like the one you just bought, only better.
text: Gain 1 [Credits] when your turn begins.
name: PAD Campaign

flavor: "Eyes forward please."
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, trace4 - if successful, the Runner cannot access any cards other than Ash 2X3ZB9CY for the remainder of this run.
name: Ash 2X3ZB9CY

flavor: Three heads. One big headache.
text:
When you rez Chimera, choose sentry, code gate, or barrier. Chimera gains that subtype until derezzed.
When a turn ends, derez Chimera.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Chimera

flavor: You're not in Kansas anymore.
text: Salvage can be advanced only while rezzed and gains "[Subroutine] Trace2 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag." for each advancement token on it.
name: Salvage

flavor: Despite its appearance, the Hokusai Grid is the most notorious research facility at Jinteki.
text:
Whenever there is a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage.
Limit 1 region per server.
name: Hokusai Grid

flavor: They don't call them dedicated for nothing.
text: If the Runner is tagged, Dedicated Response Team gains "Whenever a successful run ends, do 2 meat damage."
name: Dedicated Response Team

text:
Awakening Center can host bioroid ice (each piece of ice installed facedown, ignoring all install costs).
Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you may rez a piece of ice on Awakening Center, lowering the rez cost by 7 [Credits], to force the Runner to encounter it. Trash that ice after the run is completed.
name: Awakening Center

flavor: Success is defined by the safety of data, not the safety of potential intruders.
text:
Play only if the Runner made an unsuccessful run during his or her last turn.
Gain 7 [Credits].
name: Successful Demonstration

flavor: A mind of meat! How does it work?
text:
The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Zed 1.0.
[Subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1 [Click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1 [Click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.
name: Zed 1.0

text:
Haas Arcology AI can be advanced only while unrezzed.
[Click], hosted advancement token: Gain [Click] [Click], Use this ability only once per turn.
name: Haas Arcology AI

flavor: NEXT Design's ice provides the discerning business with a suite of ice that creates a daunting security presence for intruders.
text:
NEXT Bronze has +1 strength for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: NEXT Bronze

flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of deja vu.
text:
1 [Credits]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Himitsu-Bako

text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Trace2 - If successful, reveal the Runner's grip and trash a number of resources and/or events from it up to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.
name: Invasion of Privacy

flavor:
"They call it 'retirement.' I call it euthanasia.' "
-Ken "Express" Tenma
text:
When you score Clone Retirement, you may remove 1 bad publicity.
When the Runner steals Clone Retirement, the Corp takes 1 bad publicity.
name: Clone Retirement

flavor: "It's not personal. Urban renewal is a necessity of the modern world. It’s always someone's home, yours is no different."
text:
When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity.
[Click], [Trash]: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.
name: Elizabeth Mills

flavor: As beautiful as it is dangerous. And it's plenty dangerous.
text: The first time the Runner spends at least 1 [Click] on his or her turn, gain 2 [Credits] unless the Runner just initiated a run on this server.
name: Sundew

flavor: Blue-one level clearance doesn't exist. And if it did exist, you wouldn't be cleared to know about it.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Gain 5 [Credits] and draw 2 cards.
name: Blue Level Clearance

flavor: "It can make a real fine roller coaster, provided you’re properly stimmed up." -Noise
text:
If there is no installed fracter, Wraparound has +7 strength.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Wraparound

flavor: Once inside, the only way out is through your own mind.
text: The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2 until the beginning of the Corp's next turn.
name: Gyri Labyrinth

flavor: Tourists have flocked to Broadcast Square in even greater numbers ever since the notorious Ho-meh's crime spree ended there in a hail of flechettes. Well, that's how it happened in the sensie.
text: Whenever you are about to take at least 1 bad publicity, trace3 - if successful, avoid taking the bad publicity.
name: Broadcast Square

flavor: The first clone to serve as an NAPD detective.
text: Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you and the Runner secretly spend 0 [Credits], 1 [Credits], or 2 [Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, end the run.
name: Caprice Nisei

flavor: "Some two-cred newsy picks it up, even better. The scum could be in the alleys of Guayaquil of the slums of Bos Wash. Not to mention off-planet."
text: When you score Posted Bounty, you may forfeit it to give the Runner 1 tag and take 1 bad publicity.
name: Posted Bounty

flavor: "I'd like to remind the ladies and gentlemen of the press that several of the buildings damaged in the blast were owned by Weyland Consortium subsidiaries..."
text:
Play only if the runner is tagged.
Do 4 meat damage.
name: Scorched Earth

text: When you score Accelerated Beta Test, you may look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are ice, you may install and rez them, ignoring all costs. Trash the rest of the cards you looked at.
name: Accelerated Beta Test

flavor: My name is Viktor. Nice to meet you. Would you like to play a game?
text:
The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Viktor 1.0.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Viktor 1.0

flavor: "There's nothing worse than seeing that beautiful blue ball of data just out of reach as your connection derezzes. I think they do it just to taunt us." - Ele "Smoke" Scovak
text: [Subroutine] End the run.
name: Wall of Static

flavor:
Who knows what evil lurks in the memory diamonds of men? Weyland knows.
-unsigned cyber-graffiti
text:
Shadow can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] The Corp gains 2 [Credits].
[Subroutine] Trace 3 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Shadow

text:
Place 1 agenda counter on AstroScript Pilot Program when you score it.

Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.
name: AstroScript Pilot Program

flavor:
"Hey, hey! Wake up man. You were under a long time. What'd you see?"
"I... don't remember."
text:
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Enigma

flavor: A symbol of commerce, but beware its bite.
text:
[Subroutine] Trace3 - If successful, the Corp gains 3[Credits].
[Subroutine] Trace2 - If successful, end the run.
name: Caduceus

text:
When you score Braintrust, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
The rez cost of all ice is lowered by 1 for each agenda counter on Braintrust.
name: Braintrust

text:
When you score Project Atlas, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3.
Hosted agenda counter: Search R&D for 1 card, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
name: Project Atlas

flavor: A collection of cast-off cyberjunk. But it doesn't stay junk for long.
text:
When you rez TMI, trace2 - if unsuccessful, derez TMI.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: TMI

flavor: Peace and violence. Both must lead to the same place.
text: [Subroutine] For the remainder of this run, each piece of ice encountered except Sensei gains "[Subroutine] End the run" after all its other subroutines.
name: Sensei

flavor: Clones whisper of ChiLo as a promised land of freedom.
text:
Whenever there is a successful trace during a run on this server, give the Runner 1 tag.
Limit 1 region per server.
name: ChiLo City Grid

text:
Place 14 [Credits] from the bank on Private Contracts when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Private Contracts, trash it.
[Click]: Take 2 [Credits] from Private Contracts.
name: Private Contracts

text:
When you score Project Vitruvius, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3.
Hosted agenda counter: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
name: Project Vitruvius

flavor: Dont Tread On Me
text:
[Subroutine] Trace3 - If successful, the Runner loses [Click], if able.
[Subroutine] Trace3 - If successful, end the run.
name: Viper

text: [Subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0 [Credits], 1 [Credits], or 2 [Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, move Bullfrog so that it is the outermost piece of ice protecting another server (the Runner continues the run from this new position and is now running on this new server).
name: Bullfrog

flavor:
so very still, even
cherry blossoms are not stirred
by the temple bell
-Fuhaku
text:
2 [Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to rez ice.
name: Dedicated Server

flavor: It didn't look like the headquarters of a multi-billion cred company. Probably because it wasn't.
text: Forfeit False Lead: The Runner loses [Click] [Click], if able.
name: False Lead

flavor: "That's against the rules. The Creators will be angry."
text:
The Runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Eli 1.0.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Eli 1.0

text:
When you score Project Beale, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
Project Beale is worth 1 additional agenda point for each agenda counter on it.
name: Project Beale

text:
You have 1 additional [Click] to spend each turn.
If Director Haas is trashed while being accessed, add her to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
name: Director Haas

text:
When you score Director Haas' Pet Project, you may create a new remote server by installing up to 3 cards from HQ and/or Archives in that server and/or protecting that server (one at a time), ignoring all install costs.
Limit 1 Director Haas' Pet Project per deck.
name: Director Haas' Pet Project

flavor: Sell the dream-show them how very much they want to be rich, and they'll convince themselves that someday, they will be. How can they revolt against their future selves? - the New Gospel of Wealth
text: [Click], [Click]: Gain 3 [Credits].
name: Gila Hands Arcology

flavor: "There's only about a 5% chance this could result in a general failure."
text:
Gain 2 [Credits] when your turn begins.
Trash Server Diagnostics when you install a piece of ice.
name: Server Diagnostics

flavor: "Just another factory, making good corporate drones for the machine. Their CS department is the best in the world, though." - g00ru
text: [Click], 1 [Credits]: Search R&D for a piece of ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
name: Levy University

text: Rez a piece of bioroid ice, ignoring all costs, and install Bioroid Efficiency Research on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash Bioroid Efficiency Research and derez host ice if all of its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."
name: Bioroid Efficiency Research

flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2 [Credits] for each card revealed.
name: Celebrity Gift

flavor:
Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far
have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.
text:
The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 AI program.
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
name: Swordsman

flavor: It was surprisingly easy to make creds...if you didn't care about how you made them.
text: When you score Profiteering, take up to 3 bad publicity. Gain 5 [Credits] for each bad publicity taken.
name: Profiteering

flavor: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.
text:
The Runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Hudson 1.0.
[Subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
[Subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
name: Hudson 1.0

text:
When you score Unorthodox Predictions, choose sentry, code gate, or barrier.
Subroutines on ice of the chosen subtype cannot be broken until the beginning of your next turn.
name: Unorthodox Predictions

flavor: "The damn raven just kind of cawed at me as I went past. I should have known it was too good to be true."
text:
If TGTBT is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses TGTBT, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: TGTBT

flavor: This ice disguises itself as a series of electronic transactions, tying up the runner's funds in a thousand or so non-existent purchases and refunds. The banks' system of holds and checks means that while not a single credit ever leaves their servers the runner has no available funds. RSVP also has the unfortunate side effect of being entirely legal...strictly speaking.
text: The Runner cannot spend any credits for the remainder of this run.
name: RSVP

flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."
text: Trace5 - If successful, do meat damage to the Runner equal to the number of agenda points on agendas he or she stole during his or her last turn.
name: Punitive Counterstrike

flavor: It's easy to replace limbs. It's more difficult to replace memories.
text: When you score Veterans Program, you may remove up to 2 bad publicity.
name: Veterans Program

text:
Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must spend [Click] as an additional cost in order to steal it.
This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Strongbox.
name: Strongbox

flavor: "I did warn you that leaks would have to be patched."
text:
When you score Vulcan Coverup, do 2 meat damage.
When the Runner steals Vulcan Coverup, take 1 bad publicity.
name: Vulcan Coverup

text:
Put 12 [Credits] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when rezzed. When there are no credits left on this card, trash it.
Take 3 [Credits] from Adonis Campaign when your turn begins.
name: Adonis Campaign

flavor:
Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.
//Samurai included.
text: [Subroutine] Do 3 net damage.
name: Neural Katana

flavor: "Expensive? Not when you're protecting a fortune as large as ours."
text: If the Runner is tagged, Private Security Force gains: "[Click]: Do 1 meat damage."
name: Private Security Force

text:
Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it.
Hosted agenda counter: End the run.
name: Nisei MK II

flavor: "Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."
text: Gain [Click] [Click].
name: Biotic Labor

text:
When the Runner encounters Data Raven, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run.

Hosted power counter: Give the Runner 1 tag.
[Subroutine] Trace3 - If successful, place 1 power counter on Data Raven.
name: Data Raven

flavor: Whrrrrr!
text:
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Rototurret

flavor: Next time, read the Terms of Service more carefully. Or you might find yourself in the danger zone.
text:
As an additional cost to rez Archer, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
[Subroutine] The Corp gains 2 [Credits].
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Archer

text:
Whenever you install a piece of ice protecting this server, you may immediately rez it, lowering its rez cost by 3.
Limit 1 region per server.
name: Amazon Industrial Zone

flavor: Chop chop
text: Woodcutter can be advanced only while rezzed and gains "[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage." for each advancement token on it.
name: Woodcutter

flavor: "A job done once is a job done right."
text:
2 [Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to advance cards in or protecting this server.
name: Simone Diego

flavor: There were several ways to win a corporate war. One of them was to bring the bazookas.
text: If you have at least 7 [Credits] when you score Corporate War, gain 7 [Credits]; otherwise, lose all credits in your credit pool.
name: Corporate War

flavor: "Cheap off-the-shelf data protection. Cheap for them, that is. Not for us." - Ele "Smoke" Scovak
text:
[Subroutine] The Runner must pay 2 [Credits], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 2 [Credits], end the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Datapike

flavor: The principle behind ice is not to keep everyone out, but to let only some people in. This ice denies entry on all but a select few ports that might change with the time of day or picosecond of a connection. If you don't know what port to use, you're not getting in. Period.
text: [Subroutine] End the Run.
name: Bastion

text:
Place 3 agenda counters on Efficiency Committee when you score it.
[Click], hosted agenda counter: Gain [Click] [Click]. You cannot advance cards for the remainder of this turn.
name: Efficiency Committee

flavor: "Why limit our best assets to our own servers? The enemy doesn't stay passively at home, waiting for us to come to him. Why should we?" - Director Haas
text: Whenever the Runner suffers at least 1 brain damage, do 1 net damage.
name: Sentinel Defense Program

flavor: Who wants to start a war?
text: When you score Project Ares, the Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards for each advancement token on Project Ares over 4. If the Runner trashes at least 1 card, take 1 bad publicity.
name: Project Ares

flavor: "The thing about journalism is there's always a better story around the corner. Soon, they smelled blood elsewhere, and the world forgot about me. But I didn't forget." - The Professor
text: When you score Character Assassination, trash 1 resource (cannot be prevented).
name: Character Assassination

flavor: Pumping water into deep sea thermal vents produced huge amounts of energy. A profitable side effect.
text:
Place 2 agenda counters on Geothermal Fracking when you score it.
[Click], hosted agenda counter: Gain 7 [Credits] and take 1 bad publicity.
name: Geothermal Fracking

flavor: As reported cases of brain damage in veterans rise, mind/machine interface devices are subject to increased public scrutiny. That certain programs can cause irreparable harm to users has gone from fringe theory to accepted truth.
text:
When you rez Fenris, take 1 bad publicity.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Fenris

text:
If the Runner is tagged when you score Market Research, place 1 agenda counter on it.
Market Research is worth 1 additional agenda point while it has an agenda counter on it.
name: Market Research

flavor: "Now, let's talk about how very little you remember of the events of June sixth through sixteenth."
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Remove up to 2 bad publicity.
name: Witness Tampering

text:
The advancement requirement of NAPD Contract is increased by 1 for each bad publicity the Corp has.
As an additional cost to steal NAPD Contract, the Runner must pay 4 [Credits].
name: NAPD Contract

flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.
text:
The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Ichi 1.0.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] Trace 1 - if successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
name: Ichi 1.0

flavor:
Hedge Fund. Noun. An ingenious device by which the rich get richer even while every other poor SOB is losing his shirt.
- The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?
text: Gain 9 [Credits].
name: Hedge Fund

flavor: "Where does it go?"
text: [Subroutine] The Runner approaches the outermost piece of ice protecting the attacked server. Derez Cell Portal.
name: Cell Portal

flavor: "If it isn't in my terminal by six p.m., heads are going to roll!"
text: When you score Priority Requisition, you may rez a piece of ice ignoring all costs.
name: Priority Requisition

flavor: "We're gonna need a bigger room."
text: [Click]: Trace2 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
name: Restructured Datapool

text:
If Fetal AI is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Fetal AI, do 2 net damage. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Fetal AI from Archives.
As an additional cost to steal Fetal AI, the Runner must pay 2 [Credits]
name: Fetal AI

text:
When you score Executive Retreat, place 1 agenda counter on it and shuffle HQ into R&D.
[Click], hosted agenda counter: Draw 5 cards.
name: Executive Retreat

flavor: It's really hard to lose a government contract.
text: [Click], [Click]: Gain 4 [Credits].
name: Government Contracts

flavor: Time just slips away.
text:
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
name: Hourglass

text:
Place 16 [Credits] from the bank on Eve Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Eve Campaign, trash it.
When your turn begins, take 2 [Credits] from Eve Campaign.
name: Eve Campaign

text:
Play only if the Runner stole an agenda during his or her last turn.
Trace6 - If successful, give the Runner tags equal to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength.
name: Midseason Replacements

text:
Place 3 agenda counters on Project Wotan when you score it.
Hosted agenda counter: Choose a rezzed piece of bioroid ice currently being approached. For the remainder of this run, that ice gains "[Subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines.
name: Project Wotan

text:
The Runner can spend [Click] [Click] to break u to 2 subroutines on Viktor 2.0.
Hosted power counter: Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Trace2 - If successful, place 1 power counter on Viktor 2.0.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Viktor 2.0

flavor: "The Grim of legend was one of may so-called 'black dog' myths common to Gaelic and English-speaking communities. What's fascinating is that it has propagated to the network, where it lives on as a program that, or so the story goes, hunts for the unwary." - The Professor
text:
When you rez Grim, take 1 bad publicity.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
name: Grim

text:
When you rez Muckraker, take 1 bad publicity.
[Subroutine] Trace1 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[Subroutine] Trace2 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[Subroutine] Trace3 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[Subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
name: Muckraker

flavor: "I use bioroids because I can wipe their memories or just blow their brains out when the job is done. No witnesses means no witnesses."
text: Whenever you do meat damage, do 1 additional meat damage.
name: The Cleaners

flavor: Who watches the watcher? Probably another camera.
text: When the Runner's turn begins, give the Runner 1 tag unless he or she pays 1 [Credits].
name: City Surveillance

text:
Hive loses an "[Subroutine] End the run." subroutine for each agenda point in the Corp's score area.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Hive

flavor:
"I hear the coast is nice this time of year."
"If you're in the right business, it's nice all the year."
text:
The advancement requirement of agendas installed in this server is lowered by 1.
Limit 1 region per server.
name: SanSan City Grid

flavor: Sometimes employee reviews took a little bit longer than anticipated.
text: You have 1 additional [Click] to spend each turn.
name: Mandatory Upgrades

text:
The Runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Sherlock 1.0.
[Subroutine] Trace4 - If successful, add 1 installed program to the top of the Runner's stack.
[Subroutine] Trace4 - If successful, add 1 installed program to the top of the Runner's stack.
name: Sherlock 1.0

flavor: Where one thing ends, another begins.
text:
[Subroutine] Trace4 - If successful, the Runner cannot make another run this turn.
[Subroutine] Trace4 - If successful, end the run.
name: Uroboros

flavor: Known for luxury hoppers and a delectable sauerkraut.
text:
As an additional cost to make a run on this server, the Runner must spend [Click].
Limit 1 region per server.
name: Ruhr Valley

text:
Install only in a remote server.
The Runner cannot initiate a run on this server.
Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on HQ, trash Off the Grid.
name: Off the Grid

text:
When the Runner encounters Snoop, reveal all cards in the Runner's grip.
Hosted power counter: Reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Trash 1 of those cards.
[Subroutine] Trace3 - If successful, place 1 power counter on Snoop.
name: Snoop

flavor: "It's ice so dangerous it has safety protocols. Think about that." -g00ru
text:
End the run unless the Corp pays 1 [Credits].
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
name: Tsurugi

flavor: Thou shall not pass.
text: Tyrant can be advanced only while rezzed and gains "[Subroutine] End the run." for each advancement token on it.
name: Tyrant

text:
When you rez Shinobi, take 1 bad publicity.
[Subroutine] Trace1 - If successful, do 1 net damage.
[Subroutine] Trace2 - If successful, do 2 net damage.
[Subroutine] Trace3 - If successful, do 3 net damage and end the run.
name: Shinobi

flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large number of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.
text:
[Subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Wall of Thorns

flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden
text:
The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Heimdall 1.0.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Heimdall 1.0

flavor:
"Ever heard of a catch-22?"
"Remind me to forget it."
text:
When the Runner encounters Tollbooth, he or she must pay 3 [Credits], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 3 [Credits], end the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Tollbooth

flavor: The game has changed.
text:
The Runner can spend [Click] [Click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Ichi 2.0.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] Trace3 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
name: Ichi 2.0

text:
When you rez Swarm, take 1 bad publicity.
Swarm can be advanced and gains "[Subroutine] Trash 1 program unless the runner pays 3 [Credits]." for each advancement token on it.
name: Swarm

flavor: A bright light blossomed, and then the console went dark. That's when she smelled smoke.
text: [Subroutine]Trace6 - If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware, do 2 meat damage (cannot be prevented), and end the run.
name: Flare

flavor: "He had a bit of an ego, ol' Hadrian. his constructs live up to it though."
text:
Hadrian's Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement counter on it.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Hadrian's Wall

flavor: There are many names for those in the Administration Department. But if you like your job, you just refer to them as "sir" and "ma'am."
text: Gain 15 [Credits].
name: Restructure

flavor: The realm beyond is still forbidden.
text:
The Runner can spend [Click] [Click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Heimdall 2.0.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage and end the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Heimdall 2.0

text:
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner spends [Click] [Click].
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 3 [Credits].
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner trashes 1 installed program.
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner takes 1 brain damage.
name: Wotan

flavor:
[Subroutine] End the game.
Just kidding.
text:
If Curtain Wall is the outermost piece of ice protecting a server, it has +4 strength.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
name: Curtain Wall

flavor: Face your fear
text:
The runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Janus 1.0.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
name: Janus 1.0
